page.title: 02Work and Employment
page.content: Blackfords location astride the main route from Stirling to Perth traditionally generated work as did local agriculture both with its demand for services and also with its supply of products for processing by local industry. Blackfords main natural resource, local spring water, further led to the development of water related industries. These factors have their influence today, but in different proportions to what they once were. Undoubtably the opening in January 1981 of the new section of the A9 by-passing the village to the south has had its effect. There is still sufficient business to support in the service sector, two hotels, a guest house, an inn and several ded and breakfast establishments, but a transport cafe has closed down and a hotel lies empty.
